alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Hamilton; Hardin; Pope; Saline (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 3:52AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total sleet accumulations of up to one half inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky from the western side of Land Between the Lakes and to the Ohio River and southeastern Illinois. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of precipitation can be expected. The first will enter Southeast Missouri this afternoon and spread across all of the warning area for the evening and overnight hours. Frozen precipitation is expected for this evening through early morning Thursday. The second round will be midday Thursday through the afternoon and primarily rain for the advisory area, though issues from earlier frozen precipitation could remain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
